ygData.subject: Re: Wish List Part 1 and Why bother?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... rusty ... that or ... complicated ... Personally, I rather have it redone in either Visual Basic or Visual C/C++.  That would be the easiest way to have it

> if we somehow get our hands on the scenario file format, I'de be
> interested in working on an editor.  My programming might be kinda 
rusty
> though. It would probably be good if we could use java, because it's
> fairly simple and has free compiler and developement kit. either 
that or
> the GNU C compiler, again because it's free,  though more 
complicated
> than java I think.

Personally, I rather have it redone in either Visual Basic or Visual 
C/C++.  That would be the easiest way to have it more mouse-oriented.

>  I have a feeling the format is not overly 
complex
> and someone that knew what they were doing could probably figgure it
> out,  but that would take quite a bit of work.  it would be 
interesing
> to try and figgure out but I do have a summer vacation to enjoy and
> several other prodjects (mostly linux stuff) that I'm working on ;)

  Either way, I am going to ask for the 411 on the the file formats 
used to contain scenarios.  I would love to have a single file that 
could hold all the scenarios in a collection.
